column4: i am logged onto unbuntu edgy eft via cygwin & putty on windows xp, and i cant seem to get the complete desktop environment running.  how do i  do it?
oh okay
before i logged in using putty, i checked a box for x forwarding
why not just use VNC?
isnt when you use vnc, you have to be logged ON the remote box? i needed a different way of connecting because it's not just me that would be using the remote system
errm, i think that is true -- you mean that the VNC server requires a user to be logged on and have started a VNC session before a remote user can connect to it, right?
as i understand it, the user needs to be logged onto ubuntu, where remote desktop is enabled...... not too sure about having to start a vnc session before someone can log in to the system
I don't mean the default VNC "server" that comes on ubuntu -- I was talking about configuring and installing tightVNC or realVC
ohhh ...yeah. i think thats all you would need
when using sudo and wanting to detach from the terminal -- use sudo -b .. sudo -b gdm
in my experience .. VNC can be used by multiple people -- it most definitely does that .. and is well suited for it
does your cygwin setup have X setup too?
yes, it does
X and "startx" was executable
errm, what happens when you try and launch a gtk application like nautilus in the session?
im grabbing some of my info on this site http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cygwin/X which apparently, seems like there is a better way
umm....not familiar with it
try it out .. at your putty session -- type -  nautilus &
ohhhh....THAT.. ehhe... yeah, my file browser opened.....
eeehah :) nice
theres something else thats not quite correct as well.... everytime i open something, errors appear in my terminal
well, with my limited understanding of how this works -- seems X is forwarding right but since you haven't really connected upto the desktop, it's a little shaky
ok, seems like everthing you need is here http://www.faqs.org/docs/Linux-HOWTO/XDMCP-HOWTO.html .. what you are missing is probably that gdm isnt set to listen for XDMCP requests
ikonia also .. probably to enable XDCMP support in /etc/X11/gdm/gdm.conf
